intro: Thelycrania pubescens, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Thelycrania pubescens is adapted to arid conditions, with a deep root system that helps it survive in dry environments. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
